Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide me with the following information.
1) Between 1st July 2023 and 1st July 2024 how many School Attendance Orders were issued?
2) Between 1st July 2023 and 1st July 2024 how many of the school attendance orders that were issued were prosecuted for non-compliance?
3) Of the School Attendance Orders issued between 1st July 2023 and 1st July 2024 and prosecuted for non-compliance how many were the parent found by the court to be not guilty?
4) Of the school Attendance orders issued between 1st July 2023 and 1st July 2024 how many did result in a child being registered in school?
5)Of the School Attendance Orders issued between 1st July 2023 and 1st July 2024 how many have not been prosecuted for non-compliance or revoked?
Yours faithfully,
Michelle Louise Zaher

Dear Michelle Louise Zaher,
Thank you for your request for information relating to school attendance
orders which we received on 19/07/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 19/08/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Michelle Louise Zaher,
Thank you for your request for information relating to school attendance
orders which we received on 19/07/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1, Between 1st July 2023 and 1st July 2024 how many School Attendance
Orders were issued?
• 57
2, Between 1st July 2023 and 1st July 2024 how many of the school
attendance orders that were issued were prosecuted for non-compliance?
• 30
3, Of the School Attendance Orders issued between 1st July 2023 and 1st
July 2024 and prosecuted for non-compliance how many were the parent found
by the court to be not guilty?
• 27 (plus 5 awaiting court outcomes)
4, Of the school Attendance orders issued between 1st July 2023 and 1st
July 2024 how many did result in a child being registered in school?
• 22
5, Of the School Attendance Orders issued between 1st July 2023 and 1st
July 2024 how many have not been prosecuted for non-compliance or revoked?
• 3
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
